p.s: The newspaper article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't, written by John Worne and published in The Telegraph on the 27th January 2015, deals with the decrease of foreign language speakers in the UK.
John Worne starts ofoff his headline and states that this describes the view of the UK citizinscitizens perfectly.
He thanthen elaborates on his claim from the start and says that there is a smaller amount of students who choose to study fergeinforeign languages than in the years before.

After that John Worne makes his point of view very clear, as he disagrees with sayings of others in regard of importance of foreign languages and the development of technology as a reason not to learn them.
Moreover he talks about globalization and how useful foreign languages are, especially as criteria for a job.
He thanthen gives credits to universities that offer students to learn a language while they study another subject.
At the end he concludes that more young people need to learn a foreign language and that the parents play a major role, as they should influence their children to do so.
